newsitem.title: FRANCE: French navy in new Sierrra Leone evacuation. [CORRECTED 18:32 GMT]
newsitem.headline: French navy in new Sierrra Leone evacuation. [CORRECTED 18:32 GMT]

text.p: Two French navy vessels evacuated 734 (corrects figure from 261) foreign nationals, including three French people, from the strife-torn Sierra Leone capital of Freetown on Wednesday, the French Foreign Ministry said.
It was the second such operation by the French navy since a military coup on May 25 and subsequent clashes between the rebels and Nigerian troops.
The United States also carried out two similar operations, ferrying foreigners to a helicopter carrier at sea.

A French spokesman said the latest operation involved the frigate Germinal and light frigate Jean-Moulin and aimed at "evacuating those of our nationals who did not want to be, or could not be evacuated previously, as well as nationals of friendly foreign states who asked for our help."
